byline.contributor: Binyamin Appelbaum reported from Washington and Nelson D. Schwartz from New York.
byline.original: By BINYAMIN APPELBAUM and NELSON D. SCHWARTZ

abstract: Government estimates gross domestic product rose only 0.2 percent in first-quarter; Federal Reserve forecasts growth to rebound, suggesting it still intends to begin raising its benchmark interest rate in 2015.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve’s policy makers signaled that an interest-rate increase is still likely later this year.

headline.main: Shrugging Off Slow Growth, Fed Predicts a Rebound
headline.print_headline: Shrugging Off Slow Growth, Fed Predicts a Rebound

snippet: The Federal Reserve’s policy makers signaled that an interest-rate increase is still likely later this year.
